docs.snippet: KELLOGG--Frederick F., Jr. Kane Lodge No. 454 F. & A. M. announces with profound sorrow the death of our esteemed Brother Frederick Kellogg, Jr. on June 22, 2016 at the age of 88. A graduate of Steven Institute of Technology and Columbia Universit...
docs.lead_paragraph:
KELLOGG--Frederick F., Jr.

Kane Lodge No. 454 F. & A. M. announces with profound sorrow the death of our esteemed Brother Frederick Kellogg, Jr. on June 22, 2016 at the age of 88. A graduate of Steven Institute of Technology and Columbia University, Kellogg was a licensed engineer in four states, eventually serving as Chief Engineer for the Village of Larchemont for over two decades. To mention a few, He was a member of the Princeton Club and Mensa, as well as the Mayflower, St. Nicholas, and Huguenot Societies before joining the Lodge on December 2, 1980 where he served the craft faithfully for 36 years. Kellogg is survived by his sister, Dr. Joan Renz, by his sons Freddie and David, and by his grandchildren Alexander, Stephanie, Jennifer, and Brian. A brief memorial service was held on June 28th at the Church of the Incarnation in New York. As one of the pillars of Kane Lodge, he shall be greatly missed and warmly remembered. Mike Geller, Secretary

docs.snippet: JUDGE--James J., age 89, died in Yanceyville, NC on July 13, 2016. He formerly resided in East Hampton, NY and Garden City, NY. He was preceded in death by sons Paul and Peter. He is survived by five children - Jim, Jr. (Carol), Geoffrey, Jonathan...
docs.lead_paragraph:
JUDGE--James J.,

age 89, died in Yanceyville, NC on July 13, 2016. He formerly resided in East Hampton, NY and Garden City, NY. He was preceded in death by sons Paul and Peter. He is survived by five children - Jim, Jr. (Carol), Geoffrey, Jonathan, Sheila and Janet. He is also survived by 10 grandchildren and six great-grandchildren. Served for many years in the public relations field in both private and governmental sectors. He was also actively involved with the local Merchant Marine Veterans organization. Visitation will be held from 4-7pm at the O'Shea Funeral Home, 603 Wantagh Avenue, Wantagh, NY (exit 28 N SS Pkwy) on Thursday, July 21. A Mass of Christian Burial will be held on Friday, July 22, at St. Martin of Tours Church, Bethpage, NY at 10am with burial to follow in St. Charles Cemetery in Farmingdale, NY. www.osheafuneral.com

docs.snippet: HORBAR--Stanley. December 23, 1919 - July 14, 2016. Devoted loving husband, father, and grandfather. Born in Brooklyn, attended NYU, and honored with the Air Medal and Bronze Star for his service in WWII as an Army Captain. He was president of Dea...
docs.lead_paragraph:
HORBAR--Stanley.

December 23, 1919 - July 14, 2016. Devoted loving husband, father, and grandfather. Born in Brooklyn, attended NYU, and honored with the Air Medal and Bronze Star for his service in WWII as an Army Captain. He was president of Dearborn Manufacturing, Etz Chaim Synagogue, and Middlebay and Boca Greens Country Clubs. He retired to Florida where he spent many happy years with his beloved wife, Rita. He was Rita's "Mr. Wonderful" and the patriarch of an adoring family. He leaves an indelible mark on the hearts of all who knew and loved him.

docs.lead_paragraph:
ROGERS--Barbara Whitney,

passed away July 12, 2016 after a courageous battle with cancer. Beloved wife of Arthur, devoted mother of Arthur, Alison and Whitney and their spouses Elen, Jimmy and Jon and loving grandmother of Jimmy, Jack, Charlie, Whit, Will, Henry, Kate, Porter, Mackie, and George and caring sister of Joan Hollister and George Whitney. Service at St John's Church, Cold Spring Harbor, NY on July 28, 2016 at 11:00am.

docs.snippet: VELEZ--Anthony. Anthony "Tony" Velez, 69, photographer and activist, Vietnam veteran, beloved husband, father, brother, uncle, friend, died on July 6, 2016, surrounded by loved ones, from multiple myeloma, his second cancer linked to Agent Orange....
docs.lead_paragraph:
VELEZ--Anthony.

Anthony "Tony" Velez, 69, photographer and activist, Vietnam veteran, beloved husband, father, brother, uncle, friend, died on July 6, 2016, surrounded by loved ones, from multiple myeloma, his second cancer linked to Agent Orange. A professor of photography for twenty-seven years, he retired in 2014 from Kean University. A lifelong artist, his work has been broadly recognized, including by the New York Historical Society, New Jersey Historical Society, Norwalk Historical Society; and is part of collections held at historical societies of Brooklyn, New York, Norwalk, New Jersey, El Museo del Barrio, Bronx Museum, and Brooklyn Museum. His recent project, commissioned by the Norwalk Historical Society, is exhibited at the Norwalk Historical Society Museum. He was recipient of numerous grants and commissions, including, National Endowment of the Arts and New York Foundation for the Arts, and his work featured in numerous publications, including, "This is Brooklyn: Its Historic Districts and Landmarks", "100 New york Photographers" (2009). He was born to Puerto Rican immigrants in the south Bronx and raised there and in public housing in East New York. After serving in Vietnam in the 11th Armored Cavalry (1966-67), he organized with other veterans in Vietnam Veterans Against the War. He attended New York City's High School for Art and Design, and studied at Brooklyn College with Walter Rosenblum, and was a member of the Photographer's Forum. A New Yorker at heart, he embraced the communities he became part of in Norwalk, Connecticut, where he relocated with his wife in 2007; including, Norwalk Arts Commission, Rowayton Arts Center, and Westport Arts Center, and the community of Village Creek where he lived. He received medical care at Memorial Sloan Kettering. Special thanks to Dr. Susan Slovin, Dr. Eric Lis, and Dr. Alexander Lesokhin. He also appreciated the care that he received from doctors at the West Haven VA Hospital. Tony's intelligence, enthusiasm, warmth and zest for life was contagious and his commitment to social justice unwavering. He will be sorely missed by all who knew him, and especially by his family - Barbara Zerzan, Sophia Velez (Emily Storm), Nick Zerzan (Alex), Jessica Zerzan (Joshua Rubin), and grandchildren, Rex, Charlie and Ellie. A memorial service will be held September 17, 2016, 2pm, at his home in Norwalk, CT.

docs.snippet: PERLOV--Betty Rosenberg, 98, of Brooklyn, NY, died July 4, 2016. Daughter of Vera and Israel Rosenberg, wife of the late Sidney Perlov. Died peacefully amidst love and warmth. Survived by children, Susanna and Daniel. Also by children in-law, Kare...
docs.lead_paragraph:
PERLOV--Betty Rosenberg,

98, of Brooklyn, NY, died July 4, 2016. Daughter of Vera and Israel Rosenberg, wife of the late Sidney Perlov. Died peacefully amidst love and warmth. Survived by children, Susanna and Daniel. Also by children in-law, Karen and Martin, three grandchildren, Miriam, Eva, Francesca and two great-grandchildren. She was a speech pathologist and in 2013 published a children's book, Rifka Takes a Bow, about her childhood in the Yiddish Theater. She was inspirational and will be missed by many.

docs.snippet: BOULOGNE--Robert. Robert Edward Boulogne, was born August 26, 1957, in Montclair, NJ, to parents Robert and Margaret Boulogne. Bobby's homecoming to his eternal home, July 11, 2016 was proceeded by his battle with Melanoma. The legacy that Bobby h...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BOULOGNE--Robert.

Robert Edward Boulogne, was born August 26, 1957, in Montclair, NJ, to parents Robert and Margaret Boulogne. Bobby's homecoming to his eternal home, July 11, 2016 was proceeded by his battle with Melanoma. The legacy that Bobby has left for all was his ability to build, maintain and grow long term quality friendships. A gift to anyone who had the privilege of friendship with Bobby. Bobby's kind, genuine, fun, talented, wise and God fearing character blessed all who knew him. Please visit www.sparkman-hillcrest.com for full obituary and service information.
